Class Course

extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores information about a course that enrolled students may want to complete

      To comment method here.
      void createModules()
      Create four modules and add them to the modules list for testing purposes.
      void print()
      Prints out the details of a course and the four modules associated with the course.
      void printModules()
      Print the course's list of modules, in the requirements this is set to four, however by using a 'for' loop, there is no specific number, allowing for versatility and further scope for more modules if required.

    • Method Detail

      • createModules

        public void createModules()
        Create four modules and add them to the modules list for testing purposes. These must be your four modules. This allows for quick testing, by creating a method which will create all of our modules at once, instead of typing them out on an individual basis, allowing us to focus on the testing element.

      • addModule

        public void addModule​(Module module)

      • convertToGrade

        public Grades convertToGrade​(int mark)
        To comment method here.

      • calculateGrade

        public Grades calculateGrade​(java.util.ArrayList<ModuleMark> marks)
        Calculate the average mark from the four module marks and convert that into a final grade.

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints out the details of a course and the four modules associated with the course.

      • printModules

        public void printModules()
        Print the course's list of modules, in the requirements this is set to four, however by using a 'for' loop, there is no specific number, allowing for versatility and further scope for more modules if required.
